articles.description: England vice-captain Courtney Lawes will retire from international duty at the conclusion of the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Lawes to retire from England duty at World Cup end

articles.description: Max Verstappen climbs up from sixth on the grid to win the US Grand Prix after a close battle with Lando Norris and Lewis Hamilton.
articles.title: Verstappen wins US GP ahead of charging Hamilton

articles.description: The historic undisputed heavyweight fight between Tyson Fury v Oleksandr Usyk could become part of a superstar double bill, featuring Anthony Joshua's fight against Deontay Wilder.
articles.title: Fury v Usyk & Joshua v Wilder could be a double bill

articles.description: How has Unai Emery turned around Aston Villa's fortunes and given them a chance of achieving "something really special" this season?
articles.title: 'We need to take our dreams' – special season for ‘flying’ Villa?

articles.description: England have a platform to try and force their way back into the game's elite, but they must not squander the progress made in France says Matt Dawson.
articles.title: 'England must avoid post-2019 mistakes to build new era'

articles.description: Jermaine Jenas and Ben Mee analyse the new Aston Villa partnership of Ollie Watkins and Moussa Diaby.
articles.title: Watkins and Diaby - Aston Villa's 'fantastic' duo

articles.description: New Zealand's Mitch Santner and Trent Boult combine brilliantly to run out India batter Suryakumar Yadav during their World Cup match in Dharamsala.
articles.title: Suryakumar run out by 'outrageous' New Zealand fielding

articles.description: England fought off an impressive Tonga side to win the first match of their three-Test series, Tom Johnstone scoring twice in the second period.
articles.title: England hold off dogged Tonga to win series opener

articles.description: Arsenal's Katie McCabe calls Vivianne Miedema's return "special" after the striker makes her comeback following 11 months out through injury.
articles.title: Miedema return 'special' for Arsenal - McCabe

articles.description: Marc Guiu scores the only goal 33 seconds into his senior debut to give Barcelona a 1-0 home win over Athletic Bilbao.
articles.title: Guiu, 17, gets winner 33 seconds into Barca debut
